DataElement.preferredName: Normal Tissue Segment Not Collected Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An explanation different than the one(s) previously specified as to why sufficient normal adjacent tissue was not collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into one to three aliquots of non-neoplastic ("normal") adjacent tissue (as feasible) suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into one to three aliquots of non-neoplastic ("normal") adjacent tissue (as feasible) suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample with cellular composition and architectural patterns expected for the particular anatomic site in which it belongs. There is no evidence of abnormal cellular infiltrates or tumor mass formation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
